III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A youth at the facility is being sexually assaulted by a staff at the
facility. Other staff were not aware.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at Pine Rest on
November 13, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker and
Law Enforcement. Youth A was hesitant to speak to us and only
shared that she does laundry every day, and that Staff 2 was with
her in the laundry room. Youth A then stated she was not going to
talk to us any further and refused to answer any additional
questions. A second interview with Youth A occurred on December
2, 2024, via telephone in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth
A refused to discuss any of the allegations related to the sexual
abuse.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
November 18, 2024, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Youth B said she has been placed at River Oak for about two
months and has never had any issues with any staff. Youth B said
all the youth do their own laundry and are able to do it whenever
they need to. Youth B said youth are only allowed to go to the
laundry room one at a time and staff will supervise from the
hallway. Youth B said no staff has ever gone into the laundry room
with her. Youth B said she has never seen or heard of a staff going
into the laundry room with any other youth. Youth B said she has
not had any concerns with Staff 2 or heard of any other youth
having concerns about him.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
November 18, 2024, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Youth C said she has been at River Oak for two months. Youth C
2

said the staff at River Oak are “good” and she has never had any
concerns with any of them. Youth C said she is allowed to do her
own laundry whenever she needs to, and staff supervise from the
doorway. Youth C said she has never seen or heard of staff going
into the laundry room with youth. Youth C said she has never seen
or heard Staff 2 or any other staff being inappropriate with any
youth.
Supervisor Z was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
November 18, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker.
Supervisor Z said he is the third shift supervisor. Supervisor Z said
he has worked with Staff 2 during the on-the-job training as well as
additional shifts both on second and third shift. Supervisor Z said
during Staff 2’s training Supervisor Z trained him to move in
“three’s” and never be alone with a youth. Supervisor Z said he
has never seen Staff 2 go to the laundry room with any youth.
Supervisor Z said he never had any concerns about Staff 2’s
interaction or boundaries with Youth A or any other youth.
Supervisor Z said during one training shift he had told Staff 2 to
wake a youth up and he did so by going into the room and
“shaking” her arms. Supervisor Z said he immediately redirected
Staff 2 never to go into the room alone or touch the youth when
sleeping, however he felt this was more of training issue than a
boundary issue.
Supervisor Y was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
November 18, 2024, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Supervisor Y said he has been employed as a supervisor since
the facility opened in August 2024. Supervisor Y said he has
worked two to three days a week with Staff 2 since Staff 2’s
employment in October 2024. Supervisor Y said during one of the
shifts he worked with Staff 2, he asked where the camera blind
spots were, and he shared the information with him. Supervisor Y
said he took the question as Staff 2 just wanting to make sure he
was aware and stayed within camera view. Supervisor Y said he
has seen Staff 2 walking in the laundry room hallway completing
checks but never with any youth. Supervisor Y said he has never
seen Staff 2 in the laundry room with any youth. Supervisor Y said
Youth A disclosed the allegations directly to Staff 3, and Staff 3
called and reported the information to him, and he reported it to
MDHHS. Supervisor Y said Youth A is a youth that has made up
other information and so he is unsure of how truthful she is
regarding many things.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on November 18, 2024,
in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 1 said she has
3

been employed at River Oak since the facility opened in August
2024. Staff 1 said she works all shifts and has worked with Staff 2.
Staff 1 said she has no concerns with Staff 2 stating he is “a really
good worker”. Staff 1 said Staff 2 has appropriate boundaries with
the youth and she has not had concern about any conversations
Staff 2 has had with youth. Staff 1 said she has never seen or
heard of Staff 2 going into the laundry room with Youth A or any
other youth. Staff 1 said she sat in the hospital with Youth A on
Sunday evening. Staff 1 said Youth A told her she was not
returning to River Oak due to Staff 2 “touching her”. Staff 1 said
she did not ask Youth A any additional questions on the statement.
Staff 1 said Youth A said this in front of a nurse. Staff 1 said Youth
A did not disclose this information during the video conference she
had with a case manager. Staff 1 said she was aware the
information had already been reported to MDHHS by her
administration.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
November 18, 2024, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Staff 2 said he has been working directly with the youth at River
Oak since October 7, 2024. Staff 2 said he works mainly second
and third shift. Staff 2 said the youth at the facility will do their own
laundry whenever they need to. Staff 2 said he was trained in
class and on the job to never be alone with any youth and to move
in “groups of three”. Staff 2 said he has never been alone with
Youth A or any other youth in the laundry room or anywhere else.
Staff 2 said he is very careful with boundaries and there was only
one time when he was supervising a group of youth that were
doing their hair in the hallway mirror that Youth A asked him to put
his finger on her head as she was trying to do a certain style to
her hair and needed an extra hand, otherwise he has never
touched Youth A in any manner. Staff 2 denied brushing up next to
Youth A, touching her breasts, or her buttock. Staff 2 said he does
not feel he has done or said anything to Youth A that could be
interpreted as inappropriate.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
November 18, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff
3 said she has been employed at River Oak since beginning of
October 2024, and usually works second shift. Staff 3 said she
has worked with Staff 2 one time and during that shift she did not
have any concerns with the way he interacted with the youth. Staff
3 said she was sent to the hospital to sit with Youth A. Staff 3 said
the police officer involved reported that Youth A said she did not
want to be at the facility due to “sexual and physical abuse”. Staff
3 said she asked Youth A about this statement and Youth A
4

reported that Staff 2 had “swiped his hand on her buttock and
breasts” while in the laundry room. Staff 3 said Youth A reported
she was physically abused by “other residents”. Staff 3 said she
took a recording of the conversation between her and Youth A
regarding the sexual abuse. Staff 3 said she immediately told her
supervisor.
Assistant Facility Administrator was interviewed November
18, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Assistant
Facility Administrator said he has been employed at River Oak
since the program opened in August 2024. Assistant Facility
Administrator said he assisted in training Staff 2 and never had
any concerns with his interaction or boundaries with the youth.
Assistant Facility Administrator said he trains all staff to “move in
three’s” which means staff are never alone with one child.
Assistant Facility Administrator said he trains staff not to go into
the laundry room with the youth and has never seen or heard of
Staff 2 going into the laundry room with any youth. Assistant
Facility Administrator said no staff or youth have ever reported
concerns about Staff 2 to him.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 2’s personnel file: There was discipline for sleeping on
shift dated October 28, 2024. Staff 2 completed boundary
training on October 17, 2024.
• The recording of the conversation between Staff 3 and
Youth A was reviewed. Youth A reported to Staff 3 that Staff
2 will go into the laundry room with her and touch her
buttock and swipe across her chest. Youth A said this
happens when she is bent over putting in laundry or when
she has turned around to face him. Youth A said she has
asked Staff 2 to stop touching her and he does not listen.
Youth A said this has occurred only in the laundry room and
on four or five occasions. Youth A said she has not told
anyone because she is scared that Staff 2 will do
something to her if she tells on him.
• Youth A Corewell Health medical records dated November
10, 2024, were reviewed. Youth A was presenting with
suicidal ideation and was recommended to go to inpatient
hospitalization. There was no report of Youth A’s concerns
with being sexually abused while at the facility.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews there is no information to support a rule violation that
Staff 2 acted inappropriately and touched Youth A’s buttock or
breasts.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
5

Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation In October of 2024, a youth assaulted another youth at River Oak.
Youth injured her head and back, but there are no present signs of
injury. The staff watched the incident take place but did not
intervene or pass the information to management.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed via telephone on December 2, 2024,
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth A said the youth
“fight all the time” at the facility and that staff will always intervene.
Youth A said there are times when staff are able to stop the fight
quickly and other times when the cannot, such as when another
youth was pulling her hair, and they could not get that youth’s
hands out of her hair quickly. Youth A said she did get into a
physical altercation with Youth B at a football game and that Staff
1, “a male staff” she was unable to remember, and the police
broke the fight up.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
November 18, 2024, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Youth B said she has been placed at River Oak for about two
months and has never seen staff allow youth to fight. Youth B said
she has seen fights, she has been involved in fights with other
youth, and the staff always intervene right away and stop the
youth from fighting.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
November 18, 2024, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Youth C said most of the time all the youth get along however
there have been times when they will argue and physically fight.
Youth C said she has seen a total of four fights while at River Oak
and staff always stop the youth from fighting and have never
allowed youth to fight with one another. Youth C said the only
incident she witnessed between Youth A and Youth B was when
they were arguing, and Youth A ran into her room and Youth B
6

chased after her but then Staff 1 and Staff 3 intervened right away
and removed Youth B from Youth A’s room.
Supervisor Z was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
November 18, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker.
Supervisor Z said he has never witnessed the youth physically
fighting however they are all trained to intervene and stop the
youth from harming one another. Supervisor Z said he has never
heard or seen staff allow youth to fight at the facility.
Supervisor Y was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
November 18, 2024, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Supervisor Y said he is aware of Youth A and Youth B being
involved in two physical altercations however he was not present
for either incident. Supervisor Y said he has never seen or heard
of staff allowing the youth to physically fight.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on November 18, 2024,
in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 1 said she has
been involved in two different incidents between Youth A and
Youth B when they were physically aggressive. Staff 1 said the
first incident Youth A and Youth B were arguing, Youth A ran into
her room and Youth B followed. Staff 1 said she and Staff 3
followed Youth A and Youth B and separated them immediately
and removed Youth B from Youth A’s room. Staff 1 said the second
incident was at an Evart Football game. Staff 1 said Youth A and
Youth B began arguing and then became physically aggressive.
Staff 1 said Staff 4 was with her and he and the local law
enforcement separated Youth A and Youth B while she took the
rest of the youth to the van to be away from the incident. Staff 1
said she has never seen or heard of staff allowing the youth to
fight at the facility, stating they always intervene.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
November 18, 2024, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Staff 2 said he is not aware of any times that staff have allowed
youth to fight. Staff 2 said he has been trained to intervene
whenever there is physical harm to a youth.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
November 18, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff
3 said the youth are never allowed to fight one another and staff
always intervene and separate the youth. Staff 3 said there was a
situation when she was working where Youth A and Youth B were
arguing, and Youth A went to her room with Youth B following her.
Staff 3 said she and Staff 1 followed the youth into the bedroom
7

and separated them immediately as Youth B was “going after”
Youth A.
Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on November 21, 2024,
in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 4 said he had
previously worked at River Oak however left in October 2024.
Staff 4 said he did not have any concerns about his coworkers or
the facility. Staff 4 said there were times when he worked that the
youth at the facility would get into physical altercations and staff
always intervened and separated the youth. Staff 4 said he was
with Staff 1 at a football game when Youth A and Youth B got into
an argument that led to a physical altercation. Staff 4 said Staff 1
took the rest of the youth to the van while he and the police that
was at the game intervened and stopped Youth A and Youth B
from fighting. Staff 4 denied staff ever allowing youth to fight.
Assistant Facility Administrator was interviewed November
18, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Assistant
Facility Administrator said all staff are trained to intervene using
safe crisis management de-escalation or restraints in order to
prevent youth from harming each other. Assistant Facility
Administrator said he has never seen or heard of staff allowing
youth to fight.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth A’s medical documentation from River Oak medical
team dated October 6, 2024. The documentation reported
Youth A had a swollen nose and sore neck sustained from
fighting with Youth B at a football game.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews there is no evidence that staff are allowing youth to
assault one another.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
8

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
